title: Sam and Bill rake and mow lawns

content.description: Sam and Bill run a leaf raking and lawn mowing business. In one day, Sam can rake 3 lawns or mow 5 lawns whereas Bill can rake 2 lawns or mow 6 lawns.
content.question: Which of the following correctly describes Sam’s and Bill’s absolute and comparative advantages?

choices.label: Sam has a comparative advantage in raking and an absolute advantage in mowing.
Sam has a comparative advantage in mowing and an absolute advantage in raking.
Sam has a comparative advantage in mowing and an absolute advantage in mowing.
Bill has a comparative advantage in mowing and an absolute advantage in mowing.
Bill has a comparative advantage in raking and an absolute advantage in mowing.

content.answer: Bill has a comparative advantage in mowing and an absolute advantage in mowing.
